intro: Clethra caloneura, commonly known as the slender clethra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its slender, evergreen shrub form and its clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It produces capsule fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Clethra caloneura is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in moist, acidic soils.
